title: Not useful.
comment: I don't find a reason why someone will use it if it doesn't even recognize 10% of the characters.

Thanks for your review. The purpose of this app is to demonstrate a test of a raw, general OCR capability in the hope that developers like yourself will find tailored uses for it and add the custom image processing needed to make it into a useful app for particular situations. I look forward to seeing what you and others are able to create.

title: Looks like a good start
comment: I love supporting open source projects, but this one still needs lots of work.  The camera interface really needs a zoom mode and a switch for the flash. As it is the shadow of my phone makes it almost impossible to snap clean images.  A portrait orientation would help a lot too. I keep hitting the back button instead of the shutter and exiting. Autofocus doesn't work well either.  Finally, it needs the ability to more easily edit and save the text or open it directly in the app of my choice.
Thanks for the feedback.

title: Sony Xperia Acro S LT6w (LT26w)
comment: Плюсы: черная цветовая тема, нет рекламы, распознавание без интернета, заявлена поддержка распознавания текстов на русском языке. Минусы: имя ярлыка не соответствует названию в Google Play, нет распознавания из файла, нет русскоязычного интерфейса и справки, нет отправки результата в OfficeSuite Pro 6.5.1010, нет экспорта результата в TXT, нет кнопки Выход с выгрузкой приложения из памяти, разные иконки приложения на Google Play и в телефоне, не распознает переносы, тестовое изображение с текстом на русском языке приложение не распознало (ABBYY FineReader 11.0.102.583 это же изображение распознал без ошибок)

title: Great app!
comment: It works great for when you're in a bind and need to know what a sign says. If you're in a foreign country and don't understand the language, you can point the phone at it and it translates it for you. I recommend the continuous mode if you're phone is fast enough, it helps with getting the image to make sense.

title: Brilliant! But currently useless
comment: I don't want to be dependent on some server and require a net connection, and this is the only ocr app that runs entirely locally, so huge kudos for that - but unfortunately it mostly just captures gibberish, and if I have to edit a tiny bit of gibberish, I could have just typed it in, ocr makes most sense for long text. Improve it, make it a full ocr solution. I would pay a premium price for such an app. But I wouldn't pay for a server based solution - if I have net I can remote to my pc for ocr.

title: data abuse
comment: 8 maga at one day use uninstall!

title: Not bad for a test
comment: Great app for grabbing a UPS/FedEx tracking number off a receipt or pulling a business card into your phone.  For some reason the last update has messed up autofocus. It refuses to ever refocus when the autofocus setting is enabled. Things are nice and clear with it disabled though.  Also, enabling live preview allows you to wait until it lands on an acceptable recognition and then capture the text. This usually takes the OCR engine 3-4 tries.  Once you have the text you can long press the screen to copy or share it. This is not as obvious as it should be for new users.

title: Good idea...long way to go
comment: Concept is sound. App is designed well. Execution proved to be difficult, and exacting efforts required for meaningful results. App was used to translate French instruction sheet for a TV remote. Section headers correctly translated about 25% of the time. Smaller text only translated about 5-10% of the time.  Uninstalling for now--high hopes for future releases.

title: Simple and amazing
comment: You see something you don't understand, problem solved. The program extracts the letters from the image. Then it links with other apps like google translate to finish the job... Speachless. You do need a good quality picture. Thank's for this app!

title: GOOD BUT NOT BEST
comment: It can be extended to use sqlLite db for repetitive image scans and their outputs..   overall good app .

title: works well enough
comment: A couple things to note when using this.  First, as the name says, it's not a complete product.  That's not to say it isn't useful.  Second, make sure you've enough light on the picture you're capturing, make sure the text has enough contrast, and make sure your camera lens is clean.  Shadows will also throw it off.  One thing I wish this app had was a log for the text that's derived from the image.  That would make it pretty useful for cataloging stuff like business cards or trading cards.  As is, the only way I see to retain the text is by copying/pasting it which is relatively time consuming.

title: Very limited
comment: It works on large newspaper headlines but fails with any significant amount of text. Camera processing needs improvement plus the ability to apply OCR to existing images.

title: Perfect - just what I've always wanted!
comment: Awesome! Would love to actively beta Test. A few feature requests :-)  1. Ability to take pic first and then select the borders to ocr  2. Button linking to "Share" intent in android... Will make exporting text so much easier  3. Provide a "Share" intent interface... so we can take a picture on camera app or from *anywhere else* and push it into ocr (many phones have hardware buttons & proprietary drivers for zoom, low light photography etc.... Why not take advantage of this?)

title: Need help in making OCR app for learning project
comment: Hi I am an undergrad student and I am trying to make an android application that needs to perform OCR reading. I tried looking for open source libraries but I was not able to find any. Then I stumbled upon this, and I must say the app is really incredibly accurate and fast! I was wondering if you could publish your code that performs the OCR reading? undocumented code will also be fine! if you would like I can talk to you about my complete app. Thanks.
